concept.title: Tutorial Overview
concept.shortdesc: This tutorial walks through how to create and run a pipeline. You can download sample data so you can perform data preview, run the completed pipeline, and monitor the results.

conbody.p: We have a basic and extended version of the tutorial. The basic version allows you to read from and write to a local file system so you can easily use the sample data.

The extended version flattens and manipulates the data before writing to the Trash destination. Trash is a development destination that we use to test a pipeline without writing to a destination system. If you want, you can write to any destination that works for you.

The sample data is a file of delimited data that we'll flatten along the way. The uses a special record format for delimited data. So, in addition to learning some basic and pipeline configuration concepts, you'll see how to manipulate both delimited and flattened data.

For sample data, the tutorial uses fare payment information from a taxi company. The basic pipeline assesses the credit card vendors that customers use so you can decide later if you want to end contracts with low volume vendors. The pipeline then masks the credit card numbers before writing the results to file. A secondary branch standardizes the record format for non-credit card data.
